Text: Um um basically the job of the device is to send commands to an appliance comm in this case the television set .

Text: Um to save you getting off your backside .

Speaker: A
Text: Um and there's two main trends in th in the sort of design practice .

Text: On the one hand and this uh this particularly relates to its sort of earliest models where with you know i so so many buttons on it

Speaker: A
Text: so about the size of the television set .

Text: And most of these functions are not going to be used comm

Speaker: A
Text: it creates a rather user unfriendly interface .

Speaker: A
Text: And on the other hand there's a user focused approach

Speaker: A
Text: that pares things down to just what what is most likely to get used . Um

Speaker: A
Text: With uh a and a

Speaker: A
Text: and of course there is a certain amount of sort of loss of function here obviously comm

Speaker: A
Text: My own view is that we should definitely be going for a user focused design .

Speaker: A
Text: Um but uh the pro I think the problem with a lot of the sort of user focused designs that are about is that they sort of make assumptions in advance
